intro: Blepharis thulinii, commonly known as the narrowleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the summer months. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
